definition: to have nothing to say (idiom)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Job's three friends had no more to say.
sentences.chinese: 章約伯的三位朋友無話可說。

sentences.english: For China's diving team, nothing speaks louder.
sentences.chinese: 中國的跳水隊，無話可說的“夢之隊”。

sentences.english: No answer from Mrs. ----, just a wistful half-smile.
sentences.chinese: 該女士實在無話可說，只好苦笑。

sentences.english: One could only gasp at the sheer effrontery of the man.
sentences.chinese: 那人十足的厚顏無恥讓人們喫驚得無話可說。

sentences.english: Phase relative and one look, Cheng Xi said that we really have nothing to say?
sentences.chinese: 相人相對而望，程曦說我們真的無話可說嗎？

sentences.english: Colby discovered that there was no telling who would break or when.
sentences.chinese: 科爾比上尉發現，對崩潰之人或崩潰時刻無話可說。

sentences.english: HanShan looked at hanging in a row, courts, funny clothes at a loss for words.
sentences.chinese: 韓珊看着掛在院中的一排衣服，啼笑皆非，無話可說。

sentences.english: She makes a mean chicken stew.
sentences.chinese: 她做了一道無話可說的燉雞。

sentences.english: Hauser had argued down the landlord on this too.
sentences.chinese: 豪斯爾太太在這點上也把這個地主駁得無話可說。

sentences.english: Only chinese wine and sour plum, makes me speechless.
sentences.chinese: 惟獨是花雕加上話梅，令我無話可說。

sentences.english: She enquired after his sister, but could do no more.
sentences.chinese: 她向他問候他的妹妹，問過以後，又是無話可說。

sentences.english: Never had words seemed idler, they had so much to say.
sentences.chinese: 不說話彷彿是無話可說，其實他們有太多的話想說出。

definition: hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to blush with shame (literary)
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
not to have any meaning/meaningless
impossible/can't be done/no can do/unable to accomplish
to be confused/to be baffled
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
unwilling
hard to understand/incomprehensible
unpleasant talk/malicious words
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to both be willing/mutual consent
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
